results.title: The Diesel engine
results.brief_description: Old and new type fire syringe illustrates principles of compression, ignition and expansion. How it applies to the diesel engine. Operation and component parts of four-stroke cycle, double acting and opposed piston engines. Working of fuel injection systems.

results.title: The Die hard: the legend of Lasseter's lost gold reef
results.creator_credit: David Crocker, Supreme Films and Venture Films
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the story of Harold Lasseter’s prospecting expeditions in Western Australia and his later searches for the reef of gold he claimed to have seen in 1897, up to his death in the attempt in 1930.

results.title: Defensive play. Pt. 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Dick Van Arsdale demonstrates and describes how a player must “protect” the basket and box out his opponent from chasing his own rebound and get a “good position” from re-bounding. He goes over the fundamentals of team defence and individual defence.

results.title: Defensive play. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Dick Van Arsdale of the Phoenix Suns is a rare “four-way” player - equally good at both defense and offense and at ease both as a forward or a guard. In this film, Van Arsdale concentrates on the elements of defense at which he is so outstanding. He shows how a player must learn to position his feet and use his hands properly, shows how to fight over a “pick” and switch on a “screen”.

results.title: Diary for Timothy
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings, Basil Wright and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Timothy Jenkins was born on 3rd September 1944; this is a diary for him, a diary of the world at war into which he was born, and the transition period from war to peace. For civilians in these stirring times, life went on; a renaissance of interest in the arts was demonstrated by the enthusiasm accorded performances by such artists as John Gielgud and Dame Myra Hess in factory canteens and service hostels. The film ends with a question for Timothy: “What is he going to do when he grows up to make the world a better place for other babies who will be born into it?”. None of the characters or even events in this diary are fictitious- in fact, not a foot of this film was shot in the studios. It is a true record of old, unhappy, but not-so-far-off things made for one who was too young at the time to know what was happening, so that he may review these events when he was older. The commentary was written by E. M. Forster and spoken by Michael Redgrave.

results.title: The Dairy farm
results.brief_description: In this film we visit a mid-western American dairy farm; we watch the farmer engaged in feeding his cattle, milking the cows, preparing the milk for marketing, and such seasonal operations as cultivating, haying, and storing fodder in the silo.
results.description: In this film we visit a mid-western American dairy farm; we watch the farmer engaged in feeding his cattle, milking the cows, preparing the milk for marketing, and such seasonal operations as cultivating, haying, and storing fodder in the silo.

results.title: Diamonds
results.creator_credit: De Beers Consolidated Mining and Guild House Films
results.brief_description: Millions of tons of gravel and sand are sifted and washed in the search for diamonds in South Africa. In London the diamonds are cleaned and sorted according to size, shape, color and clarity. Most are used in industry but the finest are kept for jewellery. This age old craft of designing and making jewellery is shown as a delicate and unique work of art.

results.title: The Diagnosis of childhood schizophrenia
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Brooklyn Juvenile Guidance Centre
results.brief_description: Traces the step-by-step procedure of screening clinical data in order to establish the diagnosis of childhood schizophrenia: a process involving a review of the pertinent historical material, psychological test findings, clinical observations, and the noting of the absence of significant medical, neurological, and laboratory test results, followed by a differential diagnosis to rule out clinical syndromes with which childhood schizophrenia is commonly confused.

results.title: Diagnosing group operations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Uses demonstrations and discussion to consider the causes of problems that arise in groups: signs of conflict, withdrawal, factionalism, and group indecision, along with their crippling effect on the life of the group. Explains how to identify symptoms of group problems.

results.title: Developmental evaluation in infancy
results.brief_description: Part I shows developmental mechanisms involved in adaptive and fine motor behavior and traces the evolution of behavior from 4 weeks to 15 months. Part II shows developmental mechanism involved in gross motor behavior and traces the evolution of behavior from 4 weeks to 15 months.
